intro: Sinapis lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf mustard, is an annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a fibrous root system. Its seeds are small and contain glucosinolates, which are natural compounds with potential health benefits. Sinapis lanceolata is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural fields.
